author: Ireland's premier breaking news app
title: Mother jailed for life for murder and abuse of three-year-old son
text: A mother who beat her three-year-old son with a bamboo cane after claiming the Bible advised the use of the rod weeks before she murdered him has been jailed for life with a minimum term of 25 years. Christina Robinson, 30, had exposed her son Dwelaniyah to cruelty and excruciating pain over several weeks before she shook him to death at the family home in Durham in November 2022. Mr Justice Garnham said she was guilty of a gross abuse of trust as the victim’s mother. A trial at Newcastle Crown Court heard Robinson had deliberately immersed him in scalding water, causing severe burns that left him in agony. She did not seek medical help as safeguarding concerns would have been obvious if a health worker saw him. Robinson, a member of the Black Hebrew Israelite religion, admitted hitting the boy with a bamboo cane but claimed she was following a Bible scripture which advised the use of the rod for the “correction” of children. The defendant, originally from Tamworth, Staffordshire, was convicted of murder and four child cruelty charges which happened at the family home in Bracken Court, Ushaw Moor, Durham, following a trial in March.

author: undefined
title: Descubre las razas de perros más elegantes del mundo
text:
La elegancia canina ha sido siempre un atributo distintivo en la apreciación de los perros como compañeros y miembros destacados de la familia. Al igual que ocurre con los seres humanos, algunas razas caninas destacan por su porte distinguido, gracia natural y encanto innato.
Las razas de perro más elegantes. Fuente: Freepik. En el mundo canino, la elegancia va más allá de la apariencia física, se refleja en la postura, la movilidad, el porte y en ocasiones, incluso en el comportamiento. Descubrir las razas de perros que encarnan esta elegancia es adentrarse en un mundo fascinante donde la belleza, la gracia y la nobleza se combinan para crear compañeros caninos excepcionales.
Leer más: 3 plantas ideales para aromatizar tu hogar
Acompáñanos en este recorrido por algunas de las diez razas más distinguidas y refinadas, cuya presencia y encanto llenan de estilo cualquier hogar.
Las razas de perro más elegantes. Fuente: Freepik. Braco de Weimar: Su pelaje gris azulado y su equilibrio hacen de estos perros excelentes compañeros familiares, fuertes y protectores. Collie de pelo largo: Con su porte esbelto y pelaje exuberante, estos collies son conocidos por su carácter cariñoso y protector, ideales para vivir en familia. Crestado rodesiano: Aunque menos conocidos, estos perros destacan por su fuerza y agilidad, mostrando cariño en casa y reservas con los extraños. Dálmata: Con su característico pelaje blanco y negro, los dálmatas no solo son hermosos, sino también inteligentes y buenos guardianes para la familia. Dóberman: Majestuosidad definida, estos perros son fieles y cariñosos cuando reciben el adecuado adiestramiento y ejercicio. Galgo afgano: Reconocidos por su elegancia y melena larga, estos perros independientes disfrutan de su espacio y aportan alegría a la familia. Gran danés: A pesar de su imponente tamaño, los gran daneses son delicados y leales, anhelando compañía y mostrando gran sensibilidad. Podenco faraónico: Además de su elegancia, estos perros son conocidos por su capacidad para sonrojarse. Cariñosos y leales, necesitan un buen adiestramiento. Saluki: Considerado el ' perro real de Egipto', este lebrel es antiguo y requiere ejercicio diario para mantenerse equilibrado en casa. Setter irlandés: Con su pelaje rojo intenso y graciosos andares, estos perros familiares son cariñosos y activos, necesitando una buena dosis de actividad.
Las razas de perro más elegantes. Fuente: Freepik. Leer más: Estas son las plantas ideales para combatir los síntomas de la menopausia
Cada una de estas razas de perros no solo añade una dosis de elegancia a la vida cotidiana, sino que también brinda compañía inigualable y afecto a sus familias adoptivas.

author: @dainikbhaskar
title: 'Ayushman Bharat Yojana Health Card' camp organized | 'आयुष्मान भारत योजना स्वास्थ्य कार्ड' शिविर लगाया - Amritsar News | Dainik Bhaskar
text:
Hindi NewsLocalPunjabAmritsar- "Ayushman Bharat Yojana Health Card" Camp Organized
"आयुष्मान भारत योजना स्वास्थ्य कार्ड’ शिविर लगाया
अमृतसर सिटी1 घंटे पहले
- कॉपी लिंक
अमृतसर सिटी | शहीद मदन लाल ढींगरा कॉम्प्लेक्स की "सनातन परिवार संस्था’ ने संस्था के पदाधिकारियों डॉ. स्वराज ग्रोवर, जितेंद्र शर्मा, उर्मिला शर्मा, विनोद अरोड़ा, जगदीश महाजन और तिलक राज शर्मा की देखरेख में सामुदायिक भवन में आयुष्मान भारत योजना स्वास्थ
.
आयुष्मान स्वास्थ्य कार्ड बनाने में सामाजिक कार्यकर्ता किशोर रैना, नरेंद्र जॉली, अंकुर अरोड़ा, विक्रम ढिढोना, नुरीन महाजन का सराहनीय योगदान रहा। आयुष्मान कार्ड धारक को खतरनाक बीमारी के संपर्क में नहीं आना है। इस कार्यक्रम में वैदिक प्रवक्ता कुलदीप आर्य, अश्विनी गुप्ता, स्वर्णकांता शर्मा सहित अन्य उपस्थित थे।

author: 界面AI
title: 陆家嘴论坛召开，支持优质未盈利科技型企业上市，人工智能ETF(515980)盘中涨近1%|ETF_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
截至2025年6月19日 10:52，中证人工智能产业指数(931071)上涨0.88%，成分股 中际旭创 (300308)上涨4.28%， 中科星图 (688568)上涨3.40%， 启明星辰 (002439)上涨2.40%， 电科数字 (600850)上涨2.35%， 虹软科技 (688088)上涨2.02%。 人工智能ETF (515980)上涨0.81%。
流动性方面，人工智能ETF盘中换手2.3%，成交8041.66万元。拉长时间看，截至6月18日，人工智能ETF近1年日均成交1.18亿元。规模方面，人工智能ETF最新规模达34.73亿元。
数据显示，杠杆资金持续布局中。人工智能ETF前一交易日融资净买额达457.46万元，最新融资余额达1.22亿元。
截至6月18日，人工智能ETF近1年净值上涨21.54%。从收益能力看，截至2025年6月18日，人工智能ETF自成立以来，最高单月回报为30.38%，最长连涨月数为3个月，最长连涨涨幅为43.97%，上涨月份平均收益率为6.71%。
消息面方面，6月18日，中国证监会主席在2025 陆家嘴 论坛开幕式上表示，继续充分发挥科创板示范效应，加力推出进一步深化改革的“1+6”政策措施。其中，设置科创板科创成长层，精准支持优质未盈利科技型企业上市，成为最大的改革亮点。
华创证券指出，展望人工智能2025年下半年，1）受益于大厂加速AI与业务结合、Agent及多模态加速渗透，AI算力消耗开始从训练走向推理，并带来显著的算力增量。建议重视海外算力新技术以及增量变化，尤其是随着机柜式方案放量，重点关注液冷、PCB、铜连接等领域。
2)国内自主可控大势所趋。首先是AI芯片，其次是随着国内头部云厂商下半年算力消耗迈向50万亿+token大关之际，建议关注在出货量、生态和产品力上具有领先的公司。
3)Agent成为全球科技巨头发力方向，B和C端均开始产品快速迭代，C端更重视综合能力，B端更强调对业务流的理解、群体智能和专业Agent打造，预计各类Agent将进入快速落地阶段。
据了解，人工智能ETF(515980)是目前市场上仅有的一只跟踪人工智能产业指数（931071）的ETF产品，适配当前产业快速发展，全面开花的业态。场外投资者也可以选择华富人工智能ETF联接基金（A类008020，C类008021），通过投资目标ETF跟踪指数，布局人工智能板块中具有高增速潜质的优质企业。
风险提示：基金/股市有风险，投资需谨慎。本文关于证券市场、人工智能行业的论述仅对当下证券市场与相关行业的研究观点，基于市场环境的不确定和多变性，所涉观点后续可能随着市场发生调整或变化。本文内容仅用于投资者沟通交流之目的，不构成对任何机构和个人投资的建议或意见，不构成对投资者投资收益的承诺或保证。本文数据来自公开资料整理，不保证本文所载文字及数据的准确性及完整性，不对任何人因使用此类报告的全部或部分内容而引致的任何损失承担任何责任。投资人购买基金前，应当认真阅读《基金合同》、《招募说明书》、《产品资料概要》等基金法律文件，了解基金的风险收益特征，并根据自身的投资目的、投资期限、投资经验、资产状况等判断基金是否和投资人的风险承受能力相适应。投资人应根据个人风险承受能力和投资经验，审慎参与基金/股市投资。

author: With MAP
title: Inter-ministerial Delegation for Human Rights 'totally rejects' HRW allegation
text: The Interministerial Delegation for Human Rights (DIDH) has expressed its “total rejection” of the allegations contained in the section devoted to Morocco in the Human Rights Watch (HRW) 2023 report, published on January 11, reaffirming its willingness to interact constructively and positively with serious and professional Non-Governmental Organizations. After reviewing the section devoted to Morocco in the HRW report, the DIDH deplores, in a statement, the fact that “the organization persists in its hostile campaigns against our country and in adopting an approach to assessing the human rights situation in Morocco that deliberately transgresses the main methodological rules and standards recognized in the work of NGOs, namely impartiality, objectivity and professionalism”. Elaborating on this point, the Interministerial delegation stresses that “due to the inability of this organization to project a realistic image of human rights in Morocco, its report was limited to recycling allegations repeated in previous reports, based on one-sided and outdated narratives, conveyed by hostile parties or instrumentalizing the human rights issue for specific ends”. By way of illustration, the DIDH cites events dating back a decade or more, and others relating to issues already dealt with in the context of full respect for legal legality and human rights, while stubbornly ignoring the main reliable data provided by official sources, including those available on the official electronic pages of the UN Human Rights Mechanisms. Also, “the organization has reproduced certain paragraphs from its previous reports, in connection with its bias towards the allegations peddled by one of the associations claiming that its work is hindered, without the NGO providing any documented data likely to substantiate these allegations”. The report, notes the DIDH, “reveals the persistence of the selective approach adopted by the organization, as well as its impartiality in focusing only on certain cases brought before the courts, while ignoring others”. The organization went so far as to formulate general conclusions without providing any evidence to back them up, in the absence of an independent analysis and presentation of data drawn from a reasoned reading of judgments and judicial decisions, while ignoring the available data produced by independent institutions empowered to monitor the progress of related trials. “Some of the issues raised again in this report had been dropped in the organization’s previous reports”, the statement underlines, pointing out that revisiting these cases reveals the true intentions of the report’s authors. The report also denotes the organization’s inability to keep pace with the achievements and dynamics of human rights in Morocco, persisting in its deliberate choices to convey false allegations and facts devoid of any credibility, at a time when the Kingdom is open to all forms of international observation, particularly the United Nations human rights system, through sustained interaction over the past two years and a dynamic that has clearly demonstrated the unfounded nature of these allegations, especially as these international meetings have addressed, among other things, the issues that are the subject of this report and to which the organization has paid no attention. Another fact revealing a flagrant lack of professionalism: the organization ignored the substantial data provided by the National Human Rights Council on its role in the protection of human rights, in particular its national mechanisms whose periodic reports bear witness to the colossal efforts made by the Kingdom in the field of human rights promotion, the same source adds. According to the DIDH, the report lacks tangible and sufficient evidence to support the allegations of so-called excesses or violations, given that this organization adopts an approach of promoting the speeches of parties known for instrumentalizing human rights for political ends, resorting to vague statements denoting bad faith and hostility. The Interministerial Delegation cites allegations, including: “incarceration of individuals in alleged revenge for their criticism”, “use of twisted tactics to crush opposition and opponents”, “repressive climate”. It also adopts alleged allegations such as “the exploitation over the years of legal texts to prosecute individuals and imprison them even in the absence of evidence”, the statement points out, noting that this confirms that this report, like previous ones, lacks, from the point of view of methodology and language, objectivity, professionalism and impartiality, all foundations of the credibility and trust required in the reports of serious and responsible international NGOs. The DIDH also stresses that the organization had opted for partiality on the subject of the artificial regional dispute over the Moroccan Sahara, submitted to the UN Security Council, while ignoring Morocco’s efforts to settle this artificial regional dispute, efforts which have been described as “serious and credible” by the international community, and particularly by the UN. Instead, the organization has chosen to promote hostile allegations by Morocco’s adversaries, claiming for example that Morocco is “pressuring its Western allies to recognize its sovereignty” over the Sahara, adds the same source. In addition, the DIDH points out that the HRW also ignores the serious violations committed in the Tindouf camps, as well as the terrorist acts of the “polisario” targeting civilians and safe areas, noting that this proves that the organization has become an instrument in the hands of the enemies of the Kingdom’s territorial integrity. In this context, the Ministerial Delegation reaffirms its willingness to “interact constructively and positively with serious and professional NGOs, providing all clarifications and data that may contribute to the preparation of objective and impartial thematic reports, reflecting a true image of the reality of human rights in Morocco and contributing to its strengthening and promotion”.

author: Staff Writer
title: Charles W. Brooks | Obituaries | lancasteronline.com
text: Charles W. Brooks, 91, of Mount Joy, passed away on Saturday, December 16, 2023 at Masonic Village, Elizabethtown. Born in Mount Joy, he was the son of the late Charles E. and Bertha (Bradley) Brooks. Charles was the husband of Jo-Anne (Dunnick) Brooks with whom he celebrated 67 years of marriage this past August 25th. Charles was a graduate of the former Mount Joy High School class of 1950. He served in the United States Navy during the Korean War, and later graduated from Millersville State College. Charles was a member and past master of the Ashara-Casiphia Masonic Lodge. He worked for many years as an agent for the New York Life Insurance Company, and had a farming operation near Bainbridge. Surviving in addition to his wife, Jo-Anne, is a son, Bradley Brooks, husband of Glenna of Missouri City, TX; two granddaughters, Mallory Kretschmann and Maureen Brooks; and a great grandchild, Audrey Kretschmann. He was preceded in death by his parents and by his brother, Jay, and sister, Virginia Goodling. Charles and Jo-Anne lived for many years in Juniata County, where they enjoyed the solitude, the views, and daily walks in the woods with their dogs. Services will be private at the convenience of the family. To send an online condolence, please visit www.sheetzfuneralhome.com Plant a tree in memory of Charles Brooks A living tribute » LNP Media Group, Inc.

author: afp
title: États-Unis: Steve Bannon derrière les barreaux d’ici juillet - L'essentiel
text: États-UnisSteve Bannon derrière les barreaux d’ici juillet L’ex-éminence grise de Donald Trump, Steve Bannon, condamné à quatre mois de prison, devra commencer à purger sa peine au 1ᵉʳ juillet. L’idéologue populiste de droite américain Steve Bannon, ex-influent conseiller de Donald Trump à la Maison Blanche, devra commencer à purger sa peine de quatre mois de prison au plus tard le 1er juillet, a ordonné jeudi un juge fédéral. La peine prononcée en octobre 2022 pour entrave aux pouvoirs d’enquête du Congrès en raison du refus de Steve Bannon de coopérer à l’enquête parlementaire sur l’assaut du Capitole le 6 janvier 2021 a été confirmée en appel le 10 mai 2024. Son application avait été suspendue en raison d’un recours de la défense, mais le juge Carl Nichols a levé cette suspension à la demande de l’accusation et ordonné que le prévenu, âgé de 70 ans, se présente en prison le 1er juillet au plus tard. «Rien ne me fera taire» «Rien ne me fera taire», a réagi Steve Bannon à la sortie du tribunal, prédisant «un raz-de-marée» pour les républicains aux élections présidentielle et législatives du 5 novembre. Donald Trump, candidat républicain à la présidentielle, a déploré sur son réseau Truth social une «totale tragédie américaine», accusant de nouveau l’administration de son successeur démocrate Joe Biden «d’instrumentaliser» la justice contre ses opposants. Un autre ex-conseiller de Donald Trump à la Maison Blanche, Peter Navarro, également condamné à quatre mois de prison pour les mêmes faits, a lui commencé à purger sa peine en mars 2024. Le 6 janvier 2021, Steve Bannon avait échangé au téléphone avec Donald Trump. Ce jour-là, des centaines de partisans du président sortant avaient pris d’assaut le Capitole, siège du Congrès américain, afin de tenter d’y empêcher la certification de la victoire de Joe Biden à l’élection de novembre 2020. Donald Trump n’a pas été directement inquiété par la justice pour l’assaut du Capitole, bien que la commission d’enquête parlementaire sur le 6 janvier 2021 ait recommandé en décembre 2022 des poursuites pénales à son encontre, notamment pour appel à la rébellion et complot contre les institutions américaines. Deux autres procès Il a néanmoins été inculpé en août 2023 par un tribunal fédéral à Washington puis par la justice de l’Etat de Géorgie (sud-est) pour ses tentatives présumées illicites d’obtenir l’inversion des résultats de l’élection de 2020. Aucune date définitive n’a encore été fixée pour ces deux procès. C’est dans les derniers mois de la campagne victorieuse de Donald Trump en 2016 que Steve Bannon a commencé à imprimer sa marque, dénonçant un ordre mondial contrôlé par des élites politiques et financières. Il l’a suivi à la Maison Blanche en 2017 mais a été forcé de quitter l’exécutif en août de la même année après les violences de Charlottesville en Virginie (est), où se tenait un rassemblement de militants de la droite radicale. Une jeune femme avait trouvé la mort après qu’un sympathisant néo-nazi eut foncé en voiture dans un groupe de manifestants antiracistes.

title: EV charging stations defunct or vandalised
text:

Many electric vehicle (EV) charging stations across the country are either defunct for years or not operational around the clock, leaving EV owners—especially taxi drivers—competing for the few functional charging stations available.

author: Julia Sandor
title: Utah school officials confirm several schools were affected by PowerSchool security breach
text:
SALT LAKE CITY — Iron County and Salt Lake County school officials confirm having been affected by the PowerSchool security breach and are worried about what this means for future security.
PowerSchool, a popular provider for school-based software, had school information accessed during a nationwide cybersecurity breach. The breach compromised both teacher and student personal information such as names, email, addresses and even titles.
For Iron County School District Communications Director Shauna Lund, several of their schools were impacted.
"One thing we’ve emphasized with them and that we want to emphasize with everyone is that we do not keep our social security numbers in our power schools," said Lund. “I think any kind of delay is sort of frustrating for anybody so we’re just hoping they can get us information as quickly as possible."
“It’s unfortunate that we’re seeing more of this in this day and age," she said.
Salt Lake City School District Executive Director of Communications Yándary Chatwin confirms much of the same.
“Our district IT team has made sure that that breach has been closed, so our systems are now secure, we’re continuing to access that system and use it but we’re doing so safely," said Chatwin.
It’s not uncommon to use an outside source like Power School to store information in big school districts- but experts like University of Utah Associate Professor Sameer Patil say - it’s important to minimize the amount of information you put into it.
“In the modern era…anything that is online…is vulnerable to some degree," said Patil. "Which essentially means that, collect only that data which is absolutely necessary”
For now - all the schools effected can do - is wait.
“We’re all trying to figure this out together and to reassure our families that we’re doing our part to keep your information safe so we’ll continue to pass along that information as we receive it from the vendor," said Chatwin.
topics: Science and Technology->information technology and computer science
